title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
00:14 <sapan> has quit  
00:23 <jvelociter> has quit  
01:23 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
01:26 <lucaa> has quit  
01:27 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
01:48 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
02:05 <tekzilla\_> has quit  
02:31 <jvdrean> has quit  
02:47 <sdumitriu> has quit  
02:50 <DrLou> has quit  
03:07 <drake01> has quit  
03:14 <abusenius> has quit  
03:17 <happyfeet> has joined #xwiki  
03:18 <happyfeet> hi, i am working on a calendar application for xwiki  
03:18 <@cjdelisle> cool  
03:19 <happyfeet> i have xwiki setup but one thing i would like to change is the default port from 8080 to 8081.  
03:20 <happyfeet> where and how can i make this change?  
03:20 <@cjdelisle> are you using the exe installer version?  
03:22 <happyfeet> one moment please  
03:25 <happyfeet> I have installed the Standalone distribution  
03:25 <happyfeet> by default it points to 8080  
03:26 <happyfeet> windows.exe , yes  
03:27 <@cjdelisle> can you find a file on your disk called start\_xwiki.bat?  
03:28 <happyfeet> one moment  
03:29 <happyfeet> yes  
03:29 <happyfeet> found it  
03:29 <drake01> has joined #xwiki  
03:30 <@cjdelisle> if you open is does it say 8080 somewhere inside?  
03:31 <happyfeet> true  
03:31 <happyfeet> JETTY\_PORT  
03:31 <@cjdelisle> try changing that to 8081 and the start the wiki  
03:32 <happyfeet> one moment  
03:34 <happyfeet> excellent  
03:34 <happyfeet> it works!  
03:34 <happyfeet> back to the event calendar application  
03:35 <happyfeet> i'm just wondering what the interface should look like  
03:35 <drake01> has quit  
03:36 <@cjdelisle> hehe, that's your project (at least it's not mine, I'm no UX hacker)  
03:37 <happyfeet> ok  
03:37 <happyfeet> i'll take of that  
03:37 <happyfeet> :)  
03:38 <happyfeet> thanks  
03:45 <happyfeet11> has joined #xwiki  
03:46 <happyfeet11> can someone tell me where to locate the previous Event Calendar in XWiki  
03:46 <happyfeet11> the basic one  
03:47 <@cjdelisle> !search calander application  
03:47 <@cjdelisle> !search calander  
03:48 <@cjdelisle> useless search engine  
03:48 <@cjdelisle> try googleing xwiki calander application  
03:56 <venkatesh> has joined #xwiki  
04:00 <venkatesh> has quit  
04:01 <hppyfeet> has joined #xwiki  
04:01 <hppyfeet> hi , network issue or software problem - i'm just wondering  
04:02 <hppyfeet> i'm getting kicked out and can't get back in because the nickname is already in use  
04:02 <hppyfeet> mIRC  
04:03 <hppyfeet> it's no more fun  
04:03 <@cjdelisle> wifi?  
04:03 <hppyfeet> no  
04:03 <hppyfeet> adsl - wired  
04:04 <hppyfeet> do you know why?  
04:05 <@cjdelisle> windows tcp stack is well known for being weak  
04:05 <hppyfeet> ok  
04:06 <hppyfeet> found the calendar image  
04:06 <@cjdelisle> hmm, usually the old connections die eventually, that is odd  
04:07 <hppyfeet> i don't understand  
04:07 <hppyfeet> you're referring to the network connection  
04:08 <@cjdelisle> happyfeet11 & happyfeet usually disconnect when you lose your connection.  
04:08 <hppyfeet> yes  
04:09 <hppyfeet> now i know, the disadvantage is more time spent tyring to get back in and using too many nick ;)  
04:10 <hppyfeet> This application requires JavaScript, JavaScript framework, jQuery I guess and CSS  
04:11 <hppyfeet> Perhaps another language will be needed  
04:11 <hppyfeet> do you know?  
04:12 <@cjdelisle> We are not (currently) using jQuery, we are using prototypeJs  
04:13 <hppyfeet> what other technology might be needed to make this application for the Xwiki environment  
04:14 <drake01> has joined #xwiki  
04:15 <hppyfeet> I have used C# ASP.NET MVC 3 using SQL Server to make an Event Application  
04:15 <hppyfeet> PHP CakePHP using MySQL as well  
04:15 <@cjdelisle> It all helps but we don't use c# or php  
04:16 <hppyfeet> what technologies do you use or applicable for the event calendar app  
04:16 <hppyfeet> ???  
04:17 <hppyfeet> DB type inclusive?  
04:20 <hppyfeet> i see HQL or SQL here but which of the SQL DB types?  
04:21 <@cjdelisle> It doesn't make much sense to think in terms of db tables because our storage engine abstracts that away  
04:21 <@cjdelisle> http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/DataModel  
04:22 <hppyfeet> but new event have to be  added or created  
04:22 <hppyfeet> excellent  
04:26 <drake01> has quit  
04:27 <hppyfeet> it will be good to know basic info (technologies/application) to get started immediately  
04:27 <hppyfeet> it will be good to know basic info (technologies/architecture) to get started immediately  
04:28 <hppyfeet> i'm familiar with OOP - what OOP language is mainly used in XWiki devlopment  
04:33 <@cjdelisle> It's written in java, the applications on top are written in "apache velocity" <-- google  
04:33 <hppy> has joined #xwiki  
04:33 <@cjdelisle> !search dev guide scripting  
04:34 <hppy> good stuff but i have to go now, talk later  
04:34 <hppy> tks  
04:34 <@cjdelisle> hmm, why so soon, we were about to have the biggest channel on the network ;)  
04:36 <hppy> i'm thinking of using the numerous information you have given right away  
04:39 <hppy> i would like to copy this conversation / talk and reference it as i am hacking the UX  
04:39 <hppy> how to do that?  
04:39 <hppy> perhaps a link like the one you gave previously  
04:44 <hppy> are you there?  
04:47 <hppy> are you there cjdelisle?  
04:50 <hppy> what about xwikibot, are you there?  
04:52 <hppy> what does hacking means here...  
04:52 <hppy> what does "hacking" means here...  
04:52 <hppy> what does "hacking" means here...?  
04:55 <hppy> talk later, bye  
04:55 <hppy> has quit  
05:43 <shravan> has joined #xwiki  
05:45 <drake01> has joined #xwiki  
06:09 <shravan> has quit  
06:16 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
06:38 <drake01> has quit  
07:11 <drake01> has joined #xwiki  
07:34 <shravan> has joined #xwiki  
07:35 <@cjdelisle> howdy  
07:40 <shravan> cjdelisle: is there a debian / ubuntu for package for xwiki ?  
07:40 <@cjdelisle> nope, it would make for a nice project though  
07:41 <shravan> cjdelisle: is there a RFP which I can retitle to ITP ?  
07:41 <@cjdelisle> you'll have to tell me what those acronyms mean  
07:43 <shravan> cjdelisle: RFP -> Request to package. You can put this bug up in wnpp.debian.net  
07:44 <@cjdelisle> ahh  
07:45 <shravan> cjdelisle: ITP -> intent to package. A packager interested can retitle the RFP bug to ITP :) and then start packaing  
07:45 <@cjdelisle> I myself would aproach it by trying to get a package which works first then start bugging them to put it into their repos.  
07:46 <@cjdelisle> One issue is xwiki has a lot of third party libraries which it ships inside of the .war, you (or whoever packaged it) would have to use debian's versions.  
07:48 <shravan> cjdelisle: what are the licenses of these 3rd party libraries. Are they LGPL ?  
07:49 <@cjdelisle> yes, they are LGPL/LGPL compatable licenses.  
07:50 <@cjdelisle> (AFAIK ;) )  
07:53 <shravan> cjdelisle: will see you later have to go for my lecture bye  
07:54 <shravan> has quit

11:36 <+jvelociter> hi guys  
11:36 <@sdumitriu> Hi  
11:37 <+jvelociter> just build enterprise 3.1-SNAPSHOT from sources  
11:37 <+jvelociter> but I don't have a start\_xwiki.sh :)  
11:37 <+jvelociter> in xwiki-enterprise/distribution/jetty/hsqldb/target/xwiki-enterprise-jetty-hsqldb-3.1-SNAPSHOT/  
11:37 <+jvelociter> jvelociter$ ls  
11:37 <+jvelociter> META-INF        database        webapps

14:07 <shravan> has quit  
14:24 <@sdumitriu> Ah, found the problem with the UNVERSIONED build  
14:25 <@sdumitriu> It's the xwiki-trunks pom  
14:25 <@cjdelisle> dependencies which are versioned by ${project.version}?  
14:25 <@sdumitriu> Yes  
14:26 <@cjdelisle> Same one bit me on my cloud project.  
14:26 <@sdumitriu> Seems that ${project.version} is resolved not to the version of the pom where it is used, but to the version of the project currently built  
14:26 <DrLou> has joined #xwiki  
14:27 <@cjdelisle> it'd be cool if we could say something like <version>${parent.version}</version> then one pom file contains the actual version number  
14:37 <fmancinelli> has joined #xwiki  
14:54 <+sburjan> sdumitriu: http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XE-878 was this fixed ? afaik it was fixed  
14:56 <@sdumitriu> Checking
